posts: Need a sitter, Friday night, 5-11pm, 3 year old girl, peanut allergy
Sitter needed for Sunday afternoon, 2/19. We have two boys ages 2 adn 5. Our 5 year old has asthma

posts: Hi, we need a sitter for Friday evening(5-11pm) and Saturday afternoon(4-8pm), weekend of March 3rd. Our daughter is 1 year, very easy but teething.

specialNeeds: no medical issues, but going through teething, will need Baby Tylenol at certain intervals.

posts: Sitter for 3/10, 6-12am maybe?? We have two boys, 9 and 6. Our 9 year old is Type1 diabetic, has insulin pump, very independent with it. Will give details with interested sitter.

posts: Hi, we need a sitter for our children 3/11 from 5-8pm. We have two, 1 year old girl and 5 year old boy. Son is allergic to cow milk. Both very well behaved and easy. They love movie nights, so I'll have everything ready.:)

specialNeeds: allergic to cow milk, must drink soy instead

experience: Three years as lead teacher at St. James Preschool, Greensboro, NC. I have worked with children ages 2-5, and then did my student teaching in Second Grade. I began babysitting when I was 13 and have worked with families of children who have special needs and ages infant to preteen.

I have worked as an After School assistant for 3 years at Millis Elementary in Raleigh, NC. I am currently attending NC State to receive my degree in Early Childhood Education. Years of experience babysitting children ages 3 to 12.
Soccer Coach for local soccer league, lifeguard at YMCA, BA in Elementary Ed, UNCCH. Began my own soccer club for students after school at Jones Elementary, Chapel Hill.
Nursing student at Duke, focused my rotations with pediatrics, worked as a Nanny for Great AuPair for past two summers, lots of experience with children ages 1 month to 10 years.

Worked with youth theater in my hometown, Wilmington, NC for past 3 summers. I am a student at NC State as an Early Education major. I volunteer at the hospital in Pediatrics bimonthly and I help with the nursery at my church.
